intro: Archibaccharis hirtella, commonly known as the hairy leafear hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or near water sources. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
